oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Vince Gill - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Vince Gill (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of November 28, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Vince Gill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Pulsebeat show -- (00:41) Oklahoma Border Line (Vince Gill) -- (03:55) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (04:10) Spangler introduces Vince Gill's favorite artists; additionally, Gill jokes about not being able to discuss his favorite moments in a band -- (05:50) Spangler reflects on the new group of artists; additionally, Gill discusses the state of country music -- (07:07) The Radio (Vince Gill) -- (11:09) Spangler reflects on how music had become very influencial in Gill's life -- (11:58) Gill reflects with having to change lyrics -- (12:49) Everybody's Sweetheart (Vince Gill) -- (15:23) Spangler asks Gill what song he really wishes to hear -- (16:44) Old Shep (Elvis Presley) -- (20:56) Wayne Rodgers performs an American Red Cross commercial spot -- (21:26) Spangler discusses what Gill does in his free time, and Gill discusses what his new album is about -- (22:28) If it Weren't For Him (Vince Gill and Rosanne Cash) -- (25:41) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Gill, Vince;
